etymologies: Middle English: via Latin chamaeleon from Greek khamaileōn, from khamai ‘on the ground’ + leōn ‘lion’

definitions: a small slow-moving Old World lizard with a prehensile tail, long extensible tongue, protruding eyes that rotate independently, and a highly developed ability to change color.

notes.text: Family Chamaeleonidae: four genera, in particular Chamaeleo, and numerous species, including the European chameleon (C. vulgaris) and the common chameleon (C. chamaeleon)

shortDefinitions: small Old World lizard able to change colour

definitions: a person who changes their opinions or behavior according to the situation

examples.text: voters have misgivings about his performance as a political chameleon

shortDefinitions: person who changes opinions or behaviour according to situation
